javadoc:
An event related to component layout over a {@link FieldPanel}.
@see FieldPanelOverLayoutManager

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a new event on the given field, location, and component.

params.name: field
params.comment: the field that will have a component placed over it

params.name: component
params.comment: the component to be placed over the field

methods.javadoc:
Get the field that will have a component placed over it
@return the field
methods.name: getField
methods.comment: Get the field that will have a component placed over it

methods.javadoc:
Get the field location
@return the location of the field
methods.name: getLocation

methods.javadoc:
Get the component to be placed over the field
@return the component
methods.name: getComponent
methods.comment: Get the component to be placed over the field

methods.javadoc:
Prevent this event from being further processed.
 
 The actual layout will still occur, though.
methods.name: consume
methods.comment:
Prevent this event from being further processed.
 
 The actual layout will still occur, though.

methods.javadoc:
Check if this event has been consumed by an earlier listener.
@return true if the event has been consumed, i.e., should not be further processed
methods.name: isConsumed
methods.comment: Check if this event has been consumed by an earlier listener.

return.comment: true if the event has been consumed, i.e., should not be further processed

methods.javadoc:
Prevent the actual layout from taking place.
 
 Further listeners may still process this event, though.
methods.name: cancel
methods.comment:
Prevent the actual layout from taking place.
 
 Further listeners may still process this event, though.

methods.javadoc:
Check if the actual layout will be performed.
@return true if the layout has been cancelled.
methods.name: isCancelled
methods.comment: Check if the actual layout will be performed.

return.comment: true if the layout has been cancelled.

name: FieldPanelOverLayoutEvent
comment: An event related to component layout over a FieldPanel.
